creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: The Journey and Temptations of the Prodigal Son, wool and silk, Flemish XVc ; Warp undyed wool, 4-6 inds per cm., weft dyed wool and silk, 24-36 ends per cm.
markings: on the dais at left: \'AORP\' and \'NONW\' in mustard colored wool on a blue ground; on the base of the column: \'NA\' in salmon - colored wool on a blue ground; on the Prodigal Son\'s purse (Lower left): a gothic \'A\'.
title: The Journey and Temptations of the Prodigal Son
